docs.title: What is Filelib
docs.text:
Filelib is truly resumable file uploader that supports multiple storage options:

  1. AWS S3
  2. Digital Ocean Spaces
  3. Google Cloud Storage (Currently in development)
  4. Azure Blob Storage (Currently in development)

docs.title: What is truly resumable?
docs.text: Truly resumable upload means that when an already in-progress upload gets interrupted for any reason and a user uploads the same file again, the file upload continues where it left off instead starting from the beginning.

docs.title: Index
docs.text:
Example

Unordered ListOrdered List 
* Sed sagittis eleifend rutrum
* Donec vitae suscipit est
* Nulla tempor lobortis orci

1. Sed sagittis eleifend rutrum
2. Donec vitae suscipit est
3. Nulla tempor lobortis orci

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Filelib.com is a platform that provides truly resumable file uploads over its REST API.

We have created an SDK that will help you get started with your integration.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
FilelibPy is published as a Python package and can be installed with pip, follow the instructions below:

Installing with PIP

PIPDevelopment 
pip install filelibpy

pip install git+https://github.com/filelib/filelib-python.git#egg=filelibpy
  1. Although this will install the Filelib Python package with the latest changes, it is not a stable version and may have breaking changes.

This will install the package with all its dependencies.

TODO: Add the title of YouTube video tutorial by @JustinMusti – {Duration}m – Using Filelib API with Python.

Tip

If you are looking for an SDK for Filelib API, check out our GitHub

docs.title: Filelib Client
docs.text: After the going through the installation process, you can start using the components within the library.

docs.title: Client
docs.text:
from filelib import Client

    client = Client()
